89aca45a-a096-40a8-ad4c-96a0e13c3ff5.description: The Council Exchange Board of Trade’s Certified Membership (CEBOT Certified) is our base paid membership for minority technology companies. Members are able to participate in committee meetings and assist in the direction of local district level activities. Certified Members are included in communications about procurement and subcontract opportunities. Members are expected to promote and favorably represent the CEBOT brand. This is a voting membership class
89aca45a-a096-40a8-ad4c-96a0e13c3ff5.name: CEBOT Certified Minority Technology Company Member

issuer.summary: issued by Council Exchange Board of Trade

alignments.name: Minority Business
alignments.description: CEBOT's standard for defining minority business comes from the U.S. Department of Commerce, Office of Minority Business Development Agency. "U.S. minority business enterprises (MBEs) owned and operated by African Americans, Asian Americans, Hasidic Jews, Hispanic Americans, Native Americans, and Pacific Islanders."

alignments.name: Technology Business
alignments.description: CEBOT uses the "Technology Industries and Occupations for NAICS Industry Data" from Carnegie Mellon University's Center for Economic Development as a benchmark for what is a technology company.

alignments.name: Chubb Verified
alignments.description: This credential is a result of a market research program developed provide a level of due diligence through interviews conducted through CEBOT's Investment Member Chubb.

badge_template_activities.title: This credential is specifically for CEBOT's top Minority Tech companies. This is a group of 3,000 pre-qualified companies that have proceeded through a due diligence screening process during CEBOT's Discover 2022 Campaign. CEBOT top minority tech employers represent companies with over 10 employees. They are all located in the United States. This certification is part of CEBOT's AllianceCTA program. This credential is granted for period ending September 1, 2024.
